intro: Youngia longipes, commonly known as the slender yarrow, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia and the Americas. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and grasslands. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a slightly hairy texture. Youngia longipes produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting various pollinators.
